title: aria-invalid attribute
description: Indicates the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application. See related aria-errormessage.

assertions.title: convey the "false" value
examples: The "false" value indicates that the input does not have an error.
Screen readers may imply this by not conveying the presence of the attribute at all. Most screen readers do not explicitly indicate that the input is valid.

assertions.title: convey the "true" value
examples: The "true" value indicates that the input is invalid.

assertions.title: convey the "grammar" value
examples: The "grammar" value indicates that the input has a grammar error.

assertions.title: convey the "spelling" value
examples: The "spelling" value indicates that the input has a spelling error.
